column4: Question abt partitioning (gparted) - I'm running a Wubi install - I recently added a new hdd
Under gparted I see three devices sda sdb and sdc
I'm thinking sdc is the new hdd I added - how do I make sure that it indeed was the last added hdd?
\like form dmesg / equivalent?
Any ideas y'all?
but being pedantic
there must be a way - to see the last added device right ?
dmesg
dmesg should tell you, also, you could check previous boots in  /var/log/messages, see what the UUID of the old drive is?  I think it shows up in there.
hmm - let me chk them
http://pastebin.com/WWRhG8im
How do I know from here which was the last added disk ?
Were both discs in when you botted?
Actually 3 disk - I already had 2 disks - the 3rd disk was added in - all unfortunately 160gigs
Added after boot time, or before boot time?
before
Um.  Strange, I don't see any info in there.  Is there anything on the new drive?
Shouldn't be
Then just type fdisk -l, and the one with no partitions should be it.
if there's nothing on it, there might not BE a 1 partition.
But then again there might be.  Give it a shot.
http://pastebin.com/Kaaw7wXa -> I'm not sure which is the new one now sda1/sdc1
How do I know where my /dev/loop0 comes from (using WUBI) - through /sda1 / sdc1
how do I get that info?
